titleStmt.title: Hugh F. Finley et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6420

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his excellency Thomas E Bramlett governor of the commonwealth of Kentucky Your petitioner umphrey Bullock States that at the Feby term of the Rockcastle Circuit Court 1865 he was fined twenty five dollars for an assault upon the person of william Thompson he States that it was true that he did make an assault but it was done under very aggravating Circumstancis and that there was no damage done that he merely Struck a tap he States that he is a poore man and has a family to Support that they are dependant altogether on his labor for a Support Wherefore he umbley ask your excellency to remit Said fine
Gov Bramlette I think you will do right to remit the fine above mentioned

H F Finley
James G Carter
G. W. Roberts
Geo. W. McClure
John. F. Harris
A Smith C R c c
S Ashley A Wards
S H. Thompson
H. J. Moore C. A. R. C.
Humphrey Bullock states that the statements in the above Petition contains the truth -- Humphrey Bullock
State of Kentucky County of Rockcastle, sct
Subscribed and sworn to before me by Humfrey Bullock this 24 day of may 1865
James G Carter Notary Public R. C.

Rockcastle Cir Ct
vs
H Bullock
$25
Remitted assault
30th June 865
